text: hey guys thomas joseph here and today i
am answering some of your questions
specifically about baking the first
question i have is what are some
essential tools for baking this is like
my favorite question here it's not one
or two tools you really do need kind of
a collection of tools but once you know
what the basics are you can really get
started so for me you got to start with
hardcore equipment these are two
appliances that you really want to have
in your kitchen if you're serious about
baking a stand mixer and a food
processor and a stand mixer that is used
for all of your cakes your cupcakes or
muffins your quick breads your meringues
you can really whip things up nicely in
this machine it does all of that hard
work for you so you don't need to use
your muscle you have a really great
machine for it a food processor is used
for really fine pastry like pathways a
also known as pie dough tart dough's
biscuits and things like that
a food processor is really great there
as well now when we get into small tools
which I have over here one instrument I
would say that is completely necessary
especially here in the United States our
measuring cups and measuring spoons
these tools right here these are
instrumental in getting a recipe right
if you measure correctly you'll end up
with the same outcome time after time so
invest in a good set of these if you're
really super serious about baking a
digital scale is also great because then
you can accurately measure out your
flour your sugar whatever ingredients
some other tools that I like a ruler
it's really I think important to have a
ruler if you're rolling out pastry dough
or you're rolling out puff pastry or
something like that to certain dimension
a ruler is great to have on hand now
rolling invest in a good rolling pin
this is a French rolling pin I have here
so you really have to kind of use your
arm muscles to roll things out there are
other types of rolling pins some to have
tapered ends and also the most common
version I would say is the one that has
the handles and ball bearings so
depending on how serious you are about
rolling dough you might want to collect
a few different versions a microplane
or a wrath
is really great for grading spices
grading lemon zest it does a really fine
fine job of getting the zest nice and
small for recipes you guys have seen me
use these before these are my favorite
things these are ice cream scoops with
the lever release this is perfect for
portioning out muffins cupcake batters
it's also really great and my favorite
tool and trick for portioning out
frosting on top of cupcakes give it a
little bit of tap and it looks like a
professional
frosted your cupcake all right some
specialty tools that maybe you don't
have on hand but maybe you should invest
in these are two different versions of
dents scrapers this one's actually
called a plastic bowl scraper so this is
a curved end to get into your bowls it
helps to get batters out or you can
actually fold batters or meringues with
this and also really helpful in bread
making this is the more classic bench
scraper here it has a sharp edge to it
and so this is good for cutting biscuits
even chopping up butter into small bits
when you're making biscuits if you're
going to invest in a few pans these are
the four that I would say you should get
this is a standard nine inch or maybe
even eight inch cake pan the same
dimensions here go for a tart pan now
when you're purchasing a tart pan make
sure that you get the one that has a
removable bottom this really helps in
getting the tarts out of the pan here so
always remember that the removable
bottom a square or rectangular cake pan
and my preferred version is the one I
have in front of me that has perfectly
straight sides the corners come together
on a nice crisp 90 degree angle avoid
the ones that have rounded edges because
then your brownies your Blondie's
whatever you're making your lemon bars
are going to have a curb end to them
this gives more of a professional look
the all-purpose sheet tray here this is
also known as a cookie sheet or rimmed
baking sheet this is for all of your
cookies your whoopie pies anything
really you can make on this guy here my
last question here which is a very good
question cake flour versus self-rising
flour you really want to be careful here
with self-rising flour when you're at
the grocery store and you're looking at
the different flours available
you really only want to pick up self
rising flower if your recipe calls for
it because what that actually means is
that there's lemon or baking powder
baking soda that is going to leaven
whatever you're making if your recipe
doesn't call for that yo it's a huge
mistake do not use it your cake batter
is just going to be too voluminous and
it's going to pour out of your pan so be
really really careful now cake flour is
used in a lot of cake batters it's a
much finer ground flour and it also has
a lower protein content than all-purpose
flour which gives a finer crumb to your
cake or your muffins or your cupcakes so
really read through your recipe before
you go to the grocery store and be very
careful that you pick out the right
flour for your recipe
now guys as always any of these cool
